data.title: Joyalukkas Company Overview, Contact Details & Competitors
meta_keywords: joyalukkas headquarters address and phone number
data.meta_description: Learn more about Joyalukkas's company details, contact information, competitors, and more. Find accurate contact data easily with LeadIQ. Book a demo today.
data.text:
Global Retail Dominance Joyalukkas is the largest retail jewellery chain in the world owned by a single family, offering a vast selection of over one million meticulously designed pieces. With operations in 11 countries and online presence, there is a significant potential for global sales expansion and market penetration.

ISO Certification Advantage Having been the first jeweler in the Middle East to achieve ISO 9001:2000 certification, Joyalukkas demonstrates a commitment to quality and excellence. This certification provides a strong selling point to customers emphasizing trust, quality, and consistent standards, boosting sales opportunities.

Diversification Success Beyond jewellery retail, Joyalukkas has successfully expanded into various businesses like Joyalukkas Exchange, Jolly Silks, and Mall of Joy. Leveraging this diversified portfolio can open up cross-selling opportunities, catering to a wider customer base and enhancing overall sales potential.

Continuous Innovation Joyalukkas blends heritage and modernity in its jewellery designs, catering to a broad spectrum of customer preferences. By staying ahead of trends and consistently innovating in product offerings, there is a competitive edge that can drive increased sales and customer loyalty.

Global Brand Recognition As the 'world's favourite jeweller', Joyalukkas has garnered significant brand recognition and trust. Leveraging this global brand reputation in marketing and sales initiatives can lead to higher sales conversions and customer retention, especially in new markets.

Joyalukkas

RetailDubai, United Arab Emirates5001-10000 Employees

In 1956, Alukka Joseph Varghese opened a small retail jewellery store in Thrissur, Kerala. His son, Joy Alukkas built on his legacy, playing a key role in Alukkasâ expansion into the Middle East and further afield. Today, popularly known as Joyalukkas Jewellery, it is the largest retail jewellery chain in the world owned by a single family and offers customers the option to choose from over one million exquisitely designed pieces of jewellery in gold, diamond, precious stone, platinum, Polki and pearl. Always evolving with the latest trends in jewellery, Joyalukkas combines heritage and modernity in equal measure, with creations ranging from timeless vintage pieces rooted in Indiaâs glorious past to elegant, modern pieces crafted in 18k gold. The pieces adhere to the highest quality standards, with Joyalukkas being the first jeweller in the Middle East to get the ISO 9001:2000 certification. With the concept of beauty in every piece at its heart, Joyalukkas has been honoured with multiple awards including the prestigious Dubai Quality awards. The âJoyalukkasâ brand today has earned the tag of the âworldâs favourite jewellerâ thanks to this focus on quality and the superlative service excellence of the entityâs customer facing talent. Over the years, the company has thrived and grown at an exponential rate. It operates more than 150 stores worldwide spread across 11 countries in addition to online stores and has 9000 plus talent. Based on this solid foundation, Joyalukkas Jewellery has expanded into other businesses like Joyalukkas Exchange, Jolly Silks, Joyalukkas Lifestyle Developers and Mall of Joy, all of which come under the Joyalukkas Group. With a history of challenging the norms and holding high the flag of an unrivalled legacy, the Joyalukkas Group continues its quest to grow and scale as it expands its presence across the world.
